009package imagingbook.common.color;
010
011import java.awt.Color;
012
013import imagingbook.common.math.Matrix;
014
015public abstract class RgbUtils {
016        
017        private RgbUtils() {}
018
019        public static int[] intToRgb(int p) {
020                int[] RGB = new int[3];
021                intToRgb(p, RGB);
022                return RGB;
023        }
024        
025        public static void intToRgb(int p, int[] RGB) {
026                RGB[0] = ((p >> 16) & 0xFF);
027                RGB[1] = ((p >> 8) & 0xFF);
028                RGB[2] = (p & 0xFF);
029        }
030
031        public static int rgbToInt(int red, int grn, int blu) {
032                return ((red & 0xff)<<16) | ((grn & 0xff)<<8) | blu & 0xff;
033        }
034
035        /**
036         * Interpolates linearly between two specified colors.
037         * @param ca first color (to be interpolated from)
038         * @param cb second color (to be interpolated to)
039         * @param t interpolation coefficient, must be in [0,1]
040         * @return the interpolated color
041         */
042        public static Color interpolate(Color ca, Color cb, double t) {
043                if (t < 0 || t > 1) {
044                        throw new IllegalArgumentException("interpolation coefficient must be in [0,1] but is " + t);
045                }
046                float[] a = ca.getRGBColorComponents(null);
047                float[] b = cb.getRGBColorComponents(null);
048                float[] c = Matrix.lerp(a, b, (float) t);
049                return new Color(c[0], c[1], c[2]);
050        }
051
052        /**
053         * Interpolates linearly between the colors in the specified color palette.
054         * The interpolation coefficient must be in [0,1]. If 0, the first palette color
055         * is returned, if 1 the last color.
056         * @param palette an array of colors (at least 2)
057         * @param t interpolation coefficient, must be in [0,1]
058         * @return the interpolated color
059         */
060        public static Color interpolate(Color[] palette, double t) {
061                if (palette.length < 2) {
062                        throw new IllegalArgumentException("length of color palette must be at least 2 but is " + palette.length);
063                }
064                if (t < 0 || t > 1) {
065                        throw new IllegalArgumentException("interpolation coefficient must be in [0,1] but is " + t);
066                }
067                final int n = palette.length;
068                double x = t * (n - 1);                 // x = 0,...,n-1 (float palette index)
069                int lo = (int) Math.floor(x);   // lower palette color index
070                int hi = (int) Math.ceil(x);    // upper palette color index
071                return interpolate(palette[lo], palette[hi], x - lo);
072        }
073
074}
